contentAreas.title: Design
contentAreas.description: Learning design involves understanding how to creatively solve problems by organizing visual, interactive, or functional elements with intention. contentAreas.title: 2D Design Fundamentals
contentAreas.description: In the realm of two-dimensional art, learners delve into conceptual and visual elements. Through this exploration, they gain insight into fundamental design principles, honing their ability to analyze and visually express formal considerations when tackling studio problems, drawing inspiration from both contemporary and historical artworks.

contentAreas.title: 3D Design Fundamentals
contentAreas.description: Engaging with three-dimensional design, individuals delve into the elements of art and principles of design. Through this exploration, they develop an understanding of material properties, techniques, processes, and tools, while fostering critical thinking skills through written, theoretical, and verbal expression in their creative practice.

contentAreas.title: Digital Literacy
contentAreas.description: Digital literacy encompasses the ability to navigate, access, evaluate, and utilize information effectively and ethically in the digital landscape. It involves acquiring the skills to use technology, including devices, software, and online platforms, to communicate, collaborate, and critically engage with digital content while understanding the implications of one's actions in the online environment.

contentAreas.title: Metacognition
contentAreas.description: Engaging in metacognition involves developing an awareness and understanding of one's own thought processes. This cognitive skill encompasses the ability to reflect on and regulate one's thinking, learning strategies, and problem-solving approaches, fostering a deeper understanding of how to learn effectively and continuously improve cognitive abilities.
